questions.question: The state of affairs …………………….. sure to cause her anxiety.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun state.

questions.question: A writer and a speaker ……………………………. in that house.
questions.description: When you connect two singular subjects with and, they become plural and are followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: The introduction of reforms ………………………… greatly opposed by the aristocracy.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun introduction hence we use the singular verb.

questions.question: Time and tide ……………………………. for none.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: Bread and butter ………………………….. served for breakfast.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: The horse and carriage ………………………… waiting at the door.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: Slow and steady ……………………….. the race.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: …………………………… she know what she is doing?
questions.description: We use does here because the subject is the singular pronoun she.

questions.question: She ……………………………. one project when she started working on the next.
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of two past actions.

questions.question: I ………………………………. since morning and I was getting tired.
Each man and each woman ………………………. a vote.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Every child …………………………. love.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each and every.

questions.question: Time and tide ………………………. for none.
questions.description: If two nouns together represent one idea or refer to one person or thing, the verb is singular.

questions.question: The state of his affairs ………………………… sure to cause anxiety to his creditors.
questions.description: Here the real subject is the singular expression ‘state’.

questions.question: My father and I ………………………… soccer.
questions.description: When two singular subjects are connected by ‘and’, the verb is plural.

questions.question: He or his friend …………………………… the secret.
questions.description: When two singular subjects are connected by or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: He or his friends ………………………… responsible for this.
questions.description: When a singular noun and a plural noun are connected by ‘or’, the verb agrees with the number of the noun closest to it.

questions.question: Neither my friends nor I …………………………….. interested in this offer.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with neither and nor, the verb agrees with the number and person of the noun nearest to it.

questions.question: Either he or you …………………………. mistaken.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either and or, the verb agrees with the number and person of the noun nearest to it.

questions.question: Oil as well as gas ………………………… imported to India.
questions.description: When we connect two subjects with as well as, the verb usually agrees with the first subject in number and person.

questions.question: The mother along with her children ………………………… waiting in the lobby.
questions.description: When we connect two subjects with ‘along with’, the verb agrees with the first subject in number and person.

questions.question: Many a man …………………………. lost his life at sea.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after the expression ‘many a man’.

questions.question: The Pickwick Papers ……………………….. written by Charles Dickens.
questions.description: The names of books and magazines are all singular.

questions.question: None of my shirts ………………………… clean.
questions.description: None can be followed by a singular or plural verb.

questions.question: I would rather you ……………………… in a hostel than in a hotel.
questions.description: After would rather we use a past tense to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: You …………………………… invest your money in some profitable business.
questions.description: Had better does not have a present tense form, but it refers to the present or future. It is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: Did anyone …………………………. any question about me?
questions.description: We use the infinitive (the first form of the verb) after do, does and did.

questions.question: She …………………………. the book by December.
questions.description: We use the future perfect tense to say that something will have been done or completed by a certain time in the future.

questions.question: The Pied Piper’s music ……………………………. the rats of Hamelin.
questions.description: We use the simple past when we are specifically thinking about the past time.

questions.question: We ………………………….. coconut palms in many parts of the country.
questions.description: Use the simple present tense to talk about facts.

questions.question: Thomas as well as John ……………………… hard.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with ‘as well as’, the verb is usually singular.

questions.question: Nobody except his parents ……………………….. him.
questions.description: After nobody we usually use a singular verb.

questions.question: A lot of social issues …………………………… caused by unemployment.
questions.description: If the noun following ‘a lot of’ is a plural noun, the verb is usually plural.

questions.question: A group of us …………………….. going for a walk in the woods.
questions.description: A plural verb is usually used after the expressions ‘a number of people’ or ‘a group of people’.

questions.question: Most of my friends …………………………… no interest in politics.
questions.description: We use a plural verb after most of.

questions.question: Your jeans ………………………. too tight.
questions.description: Jeans is normally used as a plural.

questions.question: Either he or I ……………. mistaken.
Either the boy or his parents ……………… erred.
My parents and I ………………. lived here for five years.
The council …………….. elected its President.
A number of boys ………………… caught cheating on the exam.
A number of interesting suggestions ……………….. been made.
The news ……………….. true.
Each of the boys …………….. given a prize.
The chief, as well as his men, ......................... massacred.
John, as well as James, ......................... praise.
